title: The worst case scenario as ADC
body:
What would be the item choices for ADC to defend against assassin types that let you squeeze out a few more attacks if your team is falling behind?

Please no "just surrender play next game/not much you can do" that's not what I am after.

replies.body: Hexdrinker and Maw of Malmortius/Gage worth it at all or avoid?

I've actually seen a number of people turn to a tanker build on some adcs so that they can survive. Most common at the moment seem to include: 

* Maw - although it seems that the burst from kat can kill through this easily, it does help vs LB and the AP supports that are increasing in popularity
* Frozen mallet - making it slightly easier to kite the hyper-mobile assassins
* Gage - increase in damage and health when low, will definitely help you get those last hits off (and make them hit harder).

Other ones to consider:

* deaths dance - like _HeartVine_ said
* phantom dancer - the MS passive can be helpful for kiting, especially when mixed with a movement slowing item such as frozen mallet. the slight damage reduction is also a bonus.

Thanks, been using death dance and it has been pretty awesome compared to Bloodthrister, the damage as overtime really saves me from lethal damage and give enough time to recover the health from lifesteal.
Death's Dance. That 15% damage taken as a bleed effect can be the difference between getting insta-killed and sustaining yourself long enough to win (or at least not get killed).
